column1: round the wicket, left alone outside off
straighter, tucked off the pads into midwicket
good length at middle and off, straightens a touch, pushed to cover
fuller at off stump, he drives but can't beat point
tucks this into midwicket
touch more leg side, worked off the pads to the gap at midwicket. Tidy start from Maxwell
caught behind! What a huge moment. Round the wicket, it's a lovely delivery, full outside off, nips away and takes a thin nick. What a start for the Stars
stays round the wicket, back of a length outside off, punched neatly to cover
beats the edge this time, it's a nervy start for the Hurricanes as Jewell plays and misses as he drives
this is fuller and wider outside off, he's across the crease and drives to the cover sweeper
short of a length, angled in from round the wicket, tucked into square leg

cleaned him up with a beauty! What an over from Worrall. He came back over the wicket, this is a length ball around middle and leg, nipped and beat the edge to smash into middle stump. Wonderful bowling
full outside off, a strong drives find cover
not quite so full this time, picks out cover again
this time he drives on the up, straight through the covers, placed wide of long-off
touch short outside off and Short picks it up, pulls over straight midwicket...all the way to the short part of the ground
back on a full length, gets an inside edge into his boot
short again, good placement on the pull as he goes much squarer this time, rolls his wrists to keep it along the ground
over the wicket, good length at the stumps, tucked to midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to deep cover
short of a length outside off, driven square to point
back of a length outside off, driven to mid-off
drags this one down short, he's onto it with a controlled pull in front of square
flayed down to third man, width outside off, he throws his hands into a square drive and it flies off the top edge fine of short third man
goes deep the crease and tucks this down to long-on from outside off
length ball on the stumps, a googly, played back to the bowler
touch short outside off, another wrong 'un, excellent use of the crease as he rocks back and square cuts
on the stumps, skids on, pulled into midwicket...almost done by the pace
full and straight, worked off the toes to deep midwicket
short outside off, a googly, square drives towards cover where it's let through his legs by Dunk to allow some bonus runs
starts very full, dug out into the leg side
goes big over the leg side! Stand and deliver. Full on middle and leg, Short swings through the line and sends it over deep square
full outside leg stump, whipped to backward square leg
taken at long-on! The gamble fails for Short. He tried to go down the ground, can't quite get the distance, the ball was very full, and it's well taken moving to his left by Gotch
big appeal for lbw as the googly beats the inside edge and takes the front pad, but sliding down leg side
a skidder, back of a length, pushed back to the bowler
goes back outside leg stump and whips a short delivery into midwicket
fuller, outside off, he gets well forward and works into midwicket
the bottom hand takes over as he takes this from full outside off to deep midwicket
well bowled, this is a leg-break, takes a thick outside edge into backward point
short of a length, again it's played off the back foot to long-on
fuller, another one worked into that popular space at midwicket
touch short outside off but not too far from cutting it into the hands of Bravo at point
beats the inside edge and nearly bowled as he drives at the googly, not far from off stump, rebounds off Handscomb's gloves
looped up very full, plenty of air, yorker length and driven back to Zampa
works a shorter googly off his pads to short fine leg
steps back and tucks a straight delivery into midwicket
touch short again, played into the leg side to keep things ticking
round the wicket, full outside off, driven down the ground
shorter, worked off the pads behind square
fuller, slower, at the stumps and heaved to midwicket
a shorter delivery, Bailey goes back and pulls from outside leg stump to deep square
clipped off the toes through midwicket, wide of long-on which allows a second
moves outside leg stump then drives straight down the ground, some good hustle makes it a second
short outside off, crunched through the covers, splits the sweeper and long-off...Dunk brings out the slide and just keeps it in
a slower ball, down the leg side, Bailey ends up almost sweeping it to deep square
full outside off, chips a drive in the air over the covers and well short of the sweeper
full outside off, the bat face twists as he drives to long-on
full toss outside off, driven to deep cover
slower ball outside off, steered to backward point
a short ball, pulled to deep midwicket
short of a length at off stump, tapped into midwicket and excellently paced to allow a second
short, pushed down the leg side
short outside off, that's a lovely piece of timing as he punches square off the back foot through point. Gotch does well on the rope
back of a length, straight, and again it's a well-placed brace into midwicket...good batting
tucked into the leg side
pulls from outside off and finds deep midwicket
goes back to a straight delivery that skids on, square drives to cover
full, very wide outside off, a flat-batted drive wide of the cover sweeper
worked off the pads to deep midwicket
short at off stump, picked out cover off the back foot
opts to go down to long-on as he drags this from outside off
misfield at cover, by Maxwell of all people, and this back-foot drive ends up at deep cover
works a straight delivery to midwicket
drives a googly straight down the ground
an appeal for lbw as he misses a reverse sweep, may have been bat involved. Actually hit him in the stomach!
taps into the off side
drives back to the bowler
full outside off, drives down the ground to long-off
drives powerfully through the line of a delivery outside off but finds cover
picks the googly and sends it a long way into the stands over long-on...lovely clean swing from Bailey
straight down the ground this time, full outside off, another free swing of the arms and it comfortably cleared the boundary
shorter, quicker, pulled through midwicket
worked off the pads to the leg side
goes back to what is quite a full delivery, manages to work into the leg side...15 off the over. The Hurricanes starting to move
a slower ball, full at off stump, driven straight back into Bravo's boot
full at the stumps, flicked down the ground
short outside off, driven straight to cover and Bailey would have been miles short with a direct hit from Maxwell...ends up getting the second from the overthrow
back of a length outside off, 108kph slower ball, driven into the covers
gets the yorker in, but it's dug out straight down the ground and the lack off pace off the bat means there's time for the second. Terrific running
chips this back over Bravo's head to long-off and there's another couple
full, wide outside off, driven to deep cover
very wide outside off, misses the tramline, called wide but the Stars aren't happy
a yorker outside off, driven to deep cover and it's more good running
gives himself some room this time, can't reach this and not given a wide this time
another wideline yorker, well bowled, McDermott can't guide it away
dug out to the leg side
wide outside off, aims over the leg side but can only picks out long-on...came off the toe end of the bat. A slower ball
touch too short, he steps back outside leg and finds his first boundary as he drives wide of deep cover. Excellent placement
drags a sweep from wide outside off to deep midwicket
very full outside off, can't beat cover as it comes off the bottom of the bat
a length ball, googly, tapped into the off side
gives himself room outside leg, drives over the off side wide of long-off
that's a brilliant sweep, a straight delivery, goes dead square...superb placement
full toss outside off, driven down the ground to long-off
a yorker outside off, pushed down the long-on...Milenko charges back for the second, and there's an overthrow to boot. That's a superb fifty from McDermott
full outside off, driven firmly to deep cover
full and straight, drilled down the ground, Maxwell at long-on can't stop the second
dragged to deep midwicket, it's a slower ball wide outside off, McDermott tries to clear the leg side but it comes from low down off the bat. Big wicket with the set batsman gone
slower ball, on a length, worked to the leg side
well bowled, a slower ball which seems to grip and come back at the batsman, takes a bottom edge
gets beaten as he moves well outside leg and Worrall follows him
swings across the line of a length delivery and that's a fourth wicket for Worrall, it's a legspinner slower ball, Milenko aiming to heave towards midwicket
full outside off, 108kph, Archer moving around the crease and gets it through midwicket
banged in short of a length, he does well to get a couple here as he fends into midwicket
full and straight, clubs across the line and sends it to deep midwicket
gets a toe end to short third man as he swings across the line
some late inswing on a full delivery, a powerful drive finds cover
very wide outside off, swings and misses, gets the wide call
swings a delivery from very wide outside off to deep midwicket, there's all sorts of confusion in the running and Faulkner is the man out. Archer just kept on running back
gets a yorker in and it's driven over cover
walks well outside off stump and pulls a wide delivery to deep square leg...could be beaten by a good throw from the deep, but he just makes his ground. So another handy couple
wide outside off again, swings and misses, runs the bye to the keeper...there's a run out appeal at the bowler's end, think Rose has just put his bat in, but he didn't slide it over the line
full outside off and it's very nicely drive between cover and mid-off, lovely timing. Bailey can't quite flick it back
drags the length back, pushed towards point, they scamper the single and Milenko's throw goes for four overthrows! Was out with a direct hit
full and straight, defended to mid-on
big appeal for lbw as he plays across the line of a full delivery, but an inside edge into the back pad helps save him
full outside off, driven firmly back pas the bowler and straight of mid-on
length ball outside off, left alone

given caught behind, although Wade didn't appeal...Archer went up in his follow through! Short of a length, angled across outside off, Dunk aiming to force it off the back foot. Not sure he's too impressed
full outside off, 140kph, played to cover
full at the stumps, a slower ball at 114kph, defended to the off side
dragged down a touch short, Handscomb pulls in the air over midwicket and can't beat a sprawling fielder from deep square
short of a length, 137kph, nips back and hammers into the thigh pad
slower ball, full outside off, and a lovely piece of timing as he pushes through the covers
length ball outside off, nicely timed through the off side with a punchy drive
defended to the off side
straight down the ground, that's the shot of a player in form, a length ball and Stoinis pumps straight through the line
round the wicket, back of a length angled in at the stumps, worked to square leg
outside off stump, defended back to the bowler
gets well across outside off, tries to work to the leg side but sends it back to the bowler
slower ball outside off, chopped back towards the keeper
moves across the crease, very deep, flicks off the stumps to long leg
a bouncer, well directed, over middle and stump and he sways out of the line
back of a length at off stump, 139kph, defended
driven into the off-side ring
moves across outside off stump again, short of a length, gets an inside edge into the thigh pad which loops to square leg
he tries to send this out of the ground, 144kph short of a length outside off, beaten over the top edge of a mighty heave
moves outside leg stump, Meredith bowls it short and wider outside off, and it's too wide even though the batsman moved
short again, outside off at 148kph, this climbs over the top edge as he aims to go square over the off side
moving all over the crease, miles outside leg stump this time, then misses a drive and is almost bowled
another fresh air shot! Coming down the pitch and driving wildly...that's 151kph!
short on off stump, a slower ball at 126kph, holds his shape this time, gets over the top and pulls to deep square
back of a length, straight at 148kph, pushed into midwicket
short of a length at off stump, defended
gets behind the line of a shorter delivery and nudges off his hip
back of a length at off stump, 138kph, Handscomb's feet all over the place, ends up defending
pulls high over midwicket, wasn't that short, a slower ball, not out of the middle but has the legs to dribble to the rope
that's a cracking shot! Full outside off, holds his position and drives on the up wide of mid-off
follows up with a bouncer, he goes after it, a bit of top edge about the pull but it sails over short fine leg. Expensive over
full, wide outside off, and that's a wonderful cover drive which beats the sweeper
full at leg stump, pushed down the ground
full and straight, whipped through midwicket
back of a length, defended
what a beauty! A bit of magic from the leggie. A length ball, pitches on middle, grips, turns past the edge and hits the top of off stump. Stoinis offers a nod in acknowledgement
on the pads, worked to deep square leg
starts with a drag down but only costs a single as it's pulled to deep square
short outside off, fetches the pull and it goes one bounce to deep midwicket
short, wide outside off, mistimed off the bottom edge into the off side
gets this fuller, but it's into the crowd as Handscomb goes down and slog sweeps over deep square leg
short again, rocks back and nails the pull, straight to deep midwicket
back of a length, straight, tucked into midwicket. Iffy over from Short
that's big, another slog sweep ends up in the crowd over deep backward square
short outside off this time, pulls much straighter, over midwicket and it's not far off reaching the fielder...ends up being a very good save
swings and misses across the line, trying for another six
top edge which carries for six on the breeze, dragged down short, certainly not out of the middle but it just has the legs to clear deep square

tries a repeat, another top edge, taken this time! Maddinson wanted to keep going, he didn't really need to. Brings out the slog sweep, goes almost straight up, Clive Rose manages to steady himself under from short fine leg
a wonderful delivery, almost a repeat of the Stoinis wicket, the perfect leg-break that spins and beats the edge
length ball outside off, opens the face to short third man
good length, 141kph, at off stump and played back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to mid-off for a sharp single
short, wide outside off, cut in the air to deep point
there's the bouncer, 143kph, over middle and off, sways out of the line
back of a length, loses control of the drive, bottom hand comes off the bat and it goes in the air wide of cover
short of a length outside off, finds backward point
pushed into the pads, worked into midwicket
full and straight, eases it down the ground
big sweep, misses, that looked dead! Qais having a massive impact. Very full, just straightened a fraction, maybe not stone dead but taking leg stump
full at off stump, played to the leg side
gets forward and pushes back to the bowler
excellent yorker, 140kph, Maxwell was shaping for the short delivery but just manages to keep it out
just clears mid-off as he drives on the up at some width, gets away with it
short of a length outside off, lovely timing in the back foot drive, not sure if cover saw it at cover, sweeper gets around
full outside off, good-looking drive straight to cover
short of a length outside off, nicely timed again but finds backward point
a short delivery, straight, and that's a fantastic whippy pull from Gotch, takes it off his hip backward of square
full and straight, flicked to deep square leg
flicked to midwicket
how does it go there?! Plays back to a full delivery, chops it just past the stumps and it scoots fine of slip. Lucky, but it doesn't matter for the Stars
short outside off, has plenty of time to ease back and cut this well in front of the sweeper
full at the stumps, driven to long-off
gets forward and drives to cover. That's the end of Qais for the night
full outside off, drives to cover
very full outside off, angled down to third man
that's a wonderful shot, back of a length outside off, Maxwell punches it off the back foot and beats mid-on. You won't see better
responds with a short ball outside off, 138kph, beats the top edge as Maxwell pulls
short of a length outside off, not in control this time but gets it out to deep point
full outside off, 144kph, calmly drives Meredith's last ball to cover

short outside off, cracked off the back foot to deep cover...Bailey dives and pulls off a great save, but he's down and holding his arm He's in a lot of pain. Dislocation perhaps? He's helped across the boundary and being seen to by medics. Shoulder by the looks of it. He's struggling to walk at the moment. Lot of pain
short again outside off, cut to deep cover
a big long hop but just a single as it's pulled to deep midwicket
fuller, worked back to the bowler
goes deep in the crease and pulls a ball from wide outside off through midwicket, good work by McDermott in the deep
very full, a low full toss I think, clipped off the toes to deep square leg
a bouncer, ducks underneath
length ball, wide outside off, immense power through the off side and it's McDermott who again prevents the boundary
goes for the yorker, it's a low full toss, drilled very firmly towards mid-off
short of a length outside off, angled to deep point
a short delivery at the body, slower delivery, superbly pulled away, splits the gap between deep midwicket and deep square
full and straight, clipped off the toes to deep midwicket
round the wicket, short outside off, goes up and over backward point, fully in control. It's running away from Hobart
back of a length, into the pads, worked to deep square
short of a length, angled in at off stump, pushed to the off side
back-of-the-hand slower ball, very full, driven to deep cover
out of the back of the hand again, goes deep in the crease and works to midwicket
short, another slower ball, dragged down the leg side and helped round the corner with a pull
round the wicket, driven down to long-off
goes for the reverse sweep, full outside off, doesn't connect
worked down the ground to long-on, that's all they need to do
full, wide outside off, driven in the air but short of cover
short outside off, cut to deep cover, mix-up in the running but they are safe in the end
tries to cut this away, it's quite full, gets beaten
starts to move to leg then stays conventional, clipped to deep square leg

slower ball, full outside off, drilled to cover who parries it and probably saves the boundary, the return could bring a run out but Wade drops the ball at the stumps. Fast throw from Archer. Maxwell might have been safe anyway
moves outside leg stump and thumps this one bounce to long-off
backs away to a short ball and plays this brilliantly, upper cuts over point
what a way to do it! Slower ball, full outside off, and Gotch drives it inside-out over extra cover
